item.title: Elucidating the brain‚Äôs structure-function organization is key to understanding perception. A classic example are cortical columns, a vertical organization of neurons w/ similar function. They exist in primary sensory areas but it‚Äôs unclear if they are present throughout cortex
item.description: Elucidating the brain‚Äôs structure-function organization is key to understanding perception. A classic example are cortical columns, a vertical organization of neurons w/ similar function. They exist in primary sensory areas but it‚Äôs unclear if they are present throughout cortex
item.content:encoded: Elucidating the brain‚Äôs structure-function organization is key to understanding perception. A classic example are cortical columns, a vertical organization of neurons w/ similar function. They exist in primary sensory areas but it‚Äôs unclear if they are present throughout cortex

item.title: Here, we asked whether area V4, a mid-level area of the macaque visual system, is organized into functional columns. We presented grayscale natural images & recorded responses of >1200 single V4 neurons in 100 electrophysiological recording sessions using 32-channel depth probes https://t.co/JGjN7K5AFE
item.description: Here, we asked whether area V4, a mid-level area of the macaque visual system, is organized into functional columns. We presented grayscale natural images & recorded responses of >1200 single V4 neurons in 100 electrophysiological recording sessions using 32-channel depth probes https://t.co/JGjN7K5AFE
item.content:encoded: Here, we asked whether area V4, a mid-level area of the macaque visual system, is organized into functional columns. We presented grayscale natural images & recorded responses of >1200 single V4 neurons in 100 electrophysiological recording sessions using 32-channel depth probes https://t.co/JGjN7K5AFE

item.title: We fitted the readout of a pre-trained robust ResNet50 on our V4 data to predict neuronal firing rates to natural images, achieving high performance. We treated this model as a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù of macaque V4 and used it for vast in silico experimentation https://t.co/0JgczU8kW3
item.description: We fitted the readout of a pre-trained robust ResNet50 on our V4 data to predict neuronal firing rates to natural images, achieving high performance. We treated this model as a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù of macaque V4 and used it for vast in silico experimentation https://t.co/0JgczU8kW3
item.content:encoded: We fitted the readout of a pre-trained robust ResNet50 on our V4 data to predict neuronal firing rates to natural images, achieving high performance. We treated this model as a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù of macaque V4 and used it for vast in silico experimentation https://t.co/0JgczU8kW3

item.title: We used our model to generate ‚ÄúMaximally Exciting Images‚Äù (MEIs) for each neuron. These MEIs exhibited complex features like textures, shapes, or even high-level attributes such as eye-like structures in line w/ tuning properties of V4 neurons identified using parametric stimuli https://t.co/nqmDLDkgtb
item.description: We used our model to generate ‚ÄúMaximally Exciting Images‚Äù (MEIs) for each neuron. These MEIs exhibited complex features like textures, shapes, or even high-level attributes such as eye-like structures in line w/ tuning properties of V4 neurons identified using parametric stimuli https://t.co/nqmDLDkgtb
item.content:encoded: We used our model to generate ‚ÄúMaximally Exciting Images‚Äù (MEIs) for each neuron. These MEIs exhibited complex features like textures, shapes, or even high-level attributes such as eye-like structures in line w/ tuning properties of V4 neurons identified using parametric stimuli https://t.co/nqmDLDkgtb

item.title: We verified our MEIs in vivo by developing a closed-loop paradigm for acute electrophysiological recordings of single neurons. The MEI of a single neuron consistently elicited higher neuronal responses than control natural images, suggesting it is indeed the optimal stimulus https://t.co/246tbzluLR
item.description: We verified our MEIs in vivo by developing a closed-loop paradigm for acute electrophysiological recordings of single neurons. The MEI of a single neuron consistently elicited higher neuronal responses than control natural images, suggesting it is indeed the optimal stimulus https://t.co/246tbzluLR
item.content:encoded: We verified our MEIs in vivo by developing a closed-loop paradigm for acute electrophysiological recordings of single neurons. The MEI of a single neuron consistently elicited higher neuronal responses than control natural images, suggesting it is indeed the optimal stimulus https://t.co/246tbzluLR

item.title: We noticed that MEIs from single sessions were more similar to each other than to MEIs from other sessions & quantified this using psychophysics. As neurons from one session are arranged orthogonal to the surface, this suggests that V4 tuning may be organized in a columnar manner https://t.co/Im4FGbHdxa
item.description: We noticed that MEIs from single sessions were more similar to each other than to MEIs from other sessions & quantified this using psychophysics. As neurons from one session are arranged orthogonal to the surface, this suggests that V4 tuning may be organized in a columnar manner https://t.co/Im4FGbHdxa

As neurons from one session are arranged orthogonal to the surface, this suggests that V4 tuning may be organized in a columnar manner https://t.co/Im4FGbHdxa

item.title: We employed a contrastive learning method to further quantify MEI similarity within and across recording sessions & found that the mean distance between MEIs in the embedding space was significantly smaller within a session than across sessions https://t.co/s9fWyEuFmA
item.description: We employed a contrastive learning method to further quantify MEI similarity within and across recording sessions & found that the mean distance between MEIs in the embedding space was significantly smaller within a session than across sessions https://t.co/s9fWyEuFmA

item.title: Moreover, the selectivity of the neuronal population was clustered in the similarity space, suggesting that V4 tuning properties identified using the neuron‚Äôs optimal stimuli can be separated into functional groups selective for a specific feature, reminiscent of cell types https://t.co/w3od121KcL
item.description: Moreover, the selectivity of the neuronal population was clustered in the similarity space, suggesting that V4 tuning properties identified using the neuron‚Äôs optimal stimuli can be separated into functional groups selective for a specific feature, reminiscent of cell types https://t.co/w3od121KcL

item.title: The resemblance between V4 neuronal & deep artificial neural network feature selectivity can be used to generate specific hypotheses about visual tuning properties of primate V4 neurons beyond spatial patterns, such as about color boundary encoding in monkey V4 functional groups https://t.co/JD8ljKicCw
item.description: The resemblance between V4 neuronal & deep artificial neural network feature selectivity can be used to generate specific hypotheses about visual tuning properties of primate V4 neurons beyond spatial patterns, such as about color boundary encoding in monkey V4 functional groups https://t.co/JD8ljKicCw

item.title: Our findings provide evidence that functional cortical columns may be a generalizable organizing principle in the cortex, beyond primary sensory areas & demonstrates how deep learning can uncover structure-function relationships in the brain by characterizing neuronal tuning
item.description: Our findings provide evidence that functional cortical columns may be a generalizable organizing principle in the cortex, beyond primary sensory areas & demonstrates how deep learning can uncover structure-function relationships in the brain by characterizing neuronal tuning
